channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN

item.title: Report X-2023090924
item.description:
Report X-2023090924

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-16
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It has been brought to our attention that a plastic pail was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the pail was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: The content had a loose cap, resulting in leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the plastic pail's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: WET BOX FOUND IN UNLOAD. GASOLINE SMELL PROMPTED QA TO REMOVE FROM WORK AREA. DescribePack: FUEL CAP ON TOP OF LAWNMOWER LEAKED ALLOWING SOME FUEL TO SPILL OUT ONTO TOP OF BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT CAGE

Report X-2023090866

  • Description: SequenceEvent: WET PACKAGE FOUND IN UNLOAD. PACKAGE REMOVED BY QA. DescribePack: NO CLIPS OR RING SEAL ON PAINT CAN, HOWEVER, THERE WAS MASKING TAPE. LID OF CAN POPPED OPEN ALLOWING CONTENTS TO SPILL OUT, DAMAGING THE OTHER ITEM IN THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN LINED CONTAINER

item.title: Report X-2023090682
item.description:
Report X-2023090682

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T15:12:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-16
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was brought to the Memphis spill office. The fiberboard box contained a single plastic bottle and the spill agent observed that the cap was loose on the bottle. The contents of the fiberboard box were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

Report X-2023090681

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was dispatched to the dangerous goods building for a fiberboard box with signs of release. The fiberboard box contained a single glass bottle and the agent observed that the cap was loose on the bottle. The package was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023090680
item.description:
Report X-2023090680

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T15:12:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was found during sort operations in the Memphis dangerous goods building. The fiberboard box contained one metal can inside without a positive closure ring. The cause of the release was that the lid came off. The package was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2023100384
item.description:
Report E-2023100384

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-16T18:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 55 gallon drums of isopropanol (un1219) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 10 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023080412
item.description:
Report X-2023080412

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-16T18:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was dispatched to the dangerous goods building for a leaking fiberboard box. The fiberboard box contained six plastic bottles wrapped in brown paper. The cap on one of the plastic bottles was damaged causing it to spill it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for an amended shippers declaration.

item.title: Report X-2023080410
item.description:
Report X-2023080410

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-16T18:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of release during the unloading process at the Memphis hub. The fiberboard box was packaged as an all packed in one containing class 3, class 8, class 6 and class 9. While investigating the fiberboard box the spill agents discovered that a 2L plastic bottle containing UN3265 had a loose cap and released it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. The items inside of the fiberboard box were packaged with bubble wrap and styrofoam. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023070563
item.description:
Report X-2023070563

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T00:34:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR LEAKING HAZMAT. UPON CLEAN UP AND INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED INNER CONTENT ABSORBED MOST OF THE ACID, SOME DID EVENTUALLY CORRODE UNTIL THE OUTER PACKAGE WAS DAMAGED. RESPONDER PROCESSED THROUGH DMP.
